#Text=Wikinews interviews Amir Abbas Fakhravar about Iranian nuclear intentions
#Text=Tuesday , April 9 , 2013
#Text=File : Amir Philly 2 . jpg
#Text=A file photo of Amir Abbas Fakhravar .
#Text=Image : Amir Abbas Fakhravar .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Iran has been operating a nuclear program for years and announced opening a new uranium facility on Tuesday .

#Text=Its claims over nuclear enrichment are for a nuclear power program , although this requires 5 % enrichment as opposed to the 20 % enrichment level they claim the right to pursue which is more commonly used in nuclear bombs .

#Text=Wikinews interviewed Amir Abbas Fakhravar , the President of the Iranian Freedom Institute which is based in Washington DC , United States , also a research fellow at the The Institute of World Politics , about the Iranian nuclear program in light of recent talks with this week with the P5+1 group of countries .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=What is your role at the Iranian Freedom Institute ?
#Text=Amir Abbas Fakhravar : I am the President and Founder of the Iranian Freedom Institute .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=Iran seems unwilling to give up its nuclear programme , do you think they will eventually given the UN [ United Nations ] sanctions ?
#Text=AAF : The only way Islamic Regime in Iran will give up its nuclear program is either full operation and military attack by the West or total oil sanctions .
#Text=85 – 90 % of the the Islamic Republic ’s money comes from crude oil sales .
#Text=This money does not go to the Iranian people , but instead funds the nuclear program , the Revolutionary Guards , basijis , Hezbollah , and other terror operations worldwide .
#Text=The Islamic Republic will be forced into abandoning its nuclear program when oil sanctions dry up the money supply .
#Text=The Arak heavy water reactor nuclear facility in Arak , Iran .
#Text=Image : Nanking2012. .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=Do you feel the Islamic Republic of Iran is trying to provoke a response from the Western nations ( USA , UK , France , Germany ) ?

#Text=AAF : A limited military response from the West which will not be for a regime change would be a gift to the Islamic Republic , and would feed the narrative of “ overreaching , imperialistic Western governments ” perpetuated by the regime .
#Text=The IR is well aware of the rapid decline in support from the Iranian people and is looking for a way to gain back some of that support , even superficially .
#Text=An attack from the west would buoy the regime and damage the work being done by the opposition .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=What is the need for Iran to have a nuclear programme , are they doing it for energy or for weapons ?
#Text=AAF :
#Text=Iran makes clear its intentions for the nuclear program through its actions .
#Text=The regime expresses desire to annihilate Israel almost daily , and has repeatedly refused negotiation and inspection of its nuclear sites .
#Text=Also you can find several type of energies in Iran and at all they do n't need to have this expensive and dangerous nuclear energy .
#Text=For sure Islamic republic of Iran wants to have Nuclear bomb .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=If Iran does not listen and change course with regards to its nuclear program , do you think that the United Nations will apply more sanctions ?

#Text=AAF : It took a very long time to sanction the Islamic Republic to the extent it is now , and since the UN continues to send negotiators to the table to discuss Iran ’s nuclear program , tighter sanctions at this point in time are unlikely .
#Text=It is our responsibility at Iranian opposition to inform United Nations about this regime 's threat to international community .
#Text=We should move much more organize[d ] and faster to cut Islamic Republic 's diplomatic relationship with the world .
#Text=Our campaign on oil sanctions showed us it is possible .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=Do you think that the United States is particularly unhappy and international relations are poor considering that Iran recently captured a drone and refused to return it ?
#Text=AAF :

#Text=While a failure militarily and with regard to foreign policy , the captured drone incident is a relatively small event in the context of ongoing tensions between the United States and the Islamic Republic .
